com.bham.bd.components.characters

Class GameCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bham.bd.entity.BaseGameEntity
      • com.bham.bd.entity.MovingEntity
        • com.bham.bd.components.characters.GameCharacter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Agent, EnemyTestDemo, Player

    public abstract class GameCharacter
extends MovingEntity
    Represents a character - this includes enemies, players and AI companions

      • handle

        public void handle(BaseGameEntity entity)
        Handles collision of one BaseGameEntity object

        This method handles character's collision for 2 base game entities.

        • GameCharacter - for this object, the character performs 2 collision resolves: one for impulse collision and another one for the continuous collision when the characters push one another
        • Obstacle - for this object, if it doesn't an attribute WALKABLE, the character is simply moved back by the same velocity it bumped to this obstacle
        Parameters:
        entity - a generic entity that is converted to appropriate child instance the character will handle
        See Also:
        CollisionHandler

      • handle

        public void handle(List<BaseGameEntity> entities)
        Handles intersection of multiple BaseGameEntity objects
        Parameters:
        entities - a list of entities the character's collision will be checked on
        See Also:
        handle(BaseGameEntity)

      • move

        public void move(double speedMultiplier)
        Overloads basic move() method with extra speed multiplier parameter
        Parameters:
        speedMultiplier - number by which the speed will be multiplied (use negative to inverse movement)
